title: Love In The Ink 14/18
body:
Pairing: Tattoo Artist! Steve Rogers x Reader  **Soul Mate AU**

Warnings: Language. Doubts. Arguments. Adult relationship struggles.

Every tattoo you get, appears on the skin on your soul mate and vice versa. Two souls connected, their connection written in the stars. But what if you question the way soul mates work? What the hell a soul mate even is? But when you get a new tattoo done, by the gorgeous artist Steve. You get a life altering surprise as well. He’s your soul mate. How do you struggle to understand being connected and understand what you’re feeling? Will you manage to figure it out or will you end up pushing Steve away with your conspiracy theory ways?

You tuck a strand of hair behind your ear as the breeze picks up. You spot him, dark blonde hair, green eyes, tall like Steve, but not close to filled out like him. He leans against the wall on the river, waiting. He was so eager to meet up, you just didn’t find a sliver of comfort going to meet him on your own. Peter looks down at you, a brow lifted behind his sunglasses. You nod, taking a deep breathe, heading for John. He stops you as you approach, the smile slips from his face as he spots Peter.

“Why would you bring him?” He asks, glaring at Peter.

“Because there’s a chance you could be a modern day Buffalo Bill.” You shrug, leaning against the wall leaving a comfortable space between the two of you.

“Who?” His brow connects and confusion plays on his face. Your hope wasn’t even up and somehow you felt disappointed.

“Never mind.” You mumble. Steve always got your serial killer references.

“A fucking serial killer.” Peter grinds out, folding his arms over his chest. “You could be god knows what.” He huffs.

“I’m not a liar.” John smirks at Peter.

“Watch it.” Peter growls, stepping forward. You step between them. You level Peter with a look, he steps back. Turning you look at John.

“Bring him up and I’ll sucker punch you myself.” You warn him.

“Okay.” John nods slowly.

“What tattoo came first?” You fold your arms over your chest, standing in front of John, Peter stood a breathe behind you.

“Shoulder to elbow. Solar system and galaxies.” He nods.

“Why did I pick it?” You ask, wondering if you’d trip him up. He chuckles.

“You didn’t, I did.” He smiles. “Cause I’ve loved the sky, stars, and space since I was a kid.” He explains.

“Tell me, more.” You nod.

“Than came your pick. The moon, clouds and stars below your collar bone.” He speaks softly, eyeing the space covered by your shirt.

“I thought it was fitting.” You shrug.

“You’ve always found peace in the sky.” He smirks. Your head tips.

“How?” You shake your head, stunned he knew that.

“Just a guess. That’s why I picked the moon phases.” He smiles, it’s filled with hope and excitement. You’re barely even awake, let alone thrilled to hear anything he says.

“Oh.” You blink. That’s not what Steve told you, that’s not why he picked the moons.

“Than it was her.” John purrs, taking your wrist and exposing the woman tattooed on your forearm.

“Don’t touch.” Peter growls. John shoots him a dirty look but keeps talking.

“She’s you. My dream girl.” He runs his finger over the woman on your skin. You shiver, but not like with Steve, it’s cold and makes you yank your arm away from him.

“Oh brother.” Peter gags.

“Three’s a crowd baby. Lose the puppy.” John licks his lips, reaching up to touch you. You slap his hand away.

“I’m good, Ted Bundy.” You snort, shaking your head. You back up, Peter rolls his eyes turning to follow you.

“It’s John.” He calls after you. Peter throws his arm over your shoulder as he walks you back towards his car.

“Wow he’s fucking stupid.” Peter snorts.

“Steve always got my serial killer references.” You admit softly.

“I know. He has a book on them. The classics, the big ones. He used to say it was a guilty pleasure he never understood. Makes sense it was because of you.” Peter smirks at you, pulling open the door. He said it to comfort you, but all it did was tangle up your insides more.



————————



“I’m just not sure.” You sigh, running your hands through your hair. Peter was walking you to your car.

“Do me a favor.” Peter leans against your car. “Stay away from him, till I have him checked out.” He nods.

“Checked out?” You lift a brow.

“My God Father, Hap is a cop. I’ll have look into John.” Peter nods.

“Why do you care?” You snort.

“Look Y/N,” Peter sighs, scrapping his hand down his face “I know what Steve did was fucked up and wrong. I’m with you one hundred percent.” He nods, watching you. “But I trust Steve with my life at the end of the day. But that guy?” Peter scuffs. “I wouldn’t let him buy you an ice cream cone.” He snorts.

“I’m not really in the mood to see anyone anyways. I’m just going to go home.” You sigh, your shoulders sagging.

“I’ll look into this guy. Just something seems so familiar and off about things he said.” He shakes his head, his brow pulled down in concentration.

“Really?” You lift a brow, maybe you weren’t the only one.

“Like I’ve seen or heard it before.” He sighs. “I’ll figure it out.” He nods.

“Thanks Peter.” You give him a small smile, hugging him quickly. He opens your car door, waiting for you to get in. Peter closes it for you, waving as he backs up, heading for the shop.

“Why do you care?” You snort.

“Look Y/N,” Peter sighs, scrapping his hand down his face “I know what Steve did was fucked up and wrong. I’m with you one hundred percent.” He nods, watching you. “But I trust Steve with my life at the end of the day. But that guy?” Peter scuffs. “I wouldn’t let him buy you an ice cream cone.” He snorts.

“I’m not really in the mood to see anyone anyways. I’m just going to go home.” You sigh, your shoulders sagging.

“I’ll look into this guy. Just something seems so familiar and off about things he said.” He shakes his head, his brow pulled down in concentration.

“Really?” You lift a brow, maybe you weren’t the only one.

“Like I’ve seen or heard it before.” He sighs. “I’ll figure it out.” He nods.

“Thanks Peter.” You give him a small smile, hugging him quickly. He opens your car door, waiting for you to get in. Peter closes it for you, waving as he backs up, heading for the shop.

trail.content:
Pairing: Tattoo Artist! Steve Rogers x Reader  **Soul Mate AU**

Warnings: Language. Doubts. Arguments. Adult relationship struggles.

Every tattoo you get, appears on the skin on your soul mate and vice versa. Two souls connected, their connection written in the stars. But what if you question the way soul mates work? What the hell a soul mate even is? But when you get a new tattoo done, by the gorgeous artist Steve. You get a life altering surprise as well. He’s your soul mate. How do you struggle to understand being connected and understand what you’re feeling? Will you manage to figure it out or will you end up pushing Steve away with your conspiracy theory ways?

You tuck a strand of hair behind your ear as the breeze picks up. You spot him, dark blonde hair, green eyes, tall like Steve, but not close to filled out like him. He leans against the wall on the river, waiting. He was so eager to meet up, you just didn’t find a sliver of comfort going to meet him on your own. Peter looks down at you, a brow lifted behind his sunglasses. You nod, taking a deep breathe, heading for John. He stops you as you approach, the smile slips from his face as he spots Peter.

“Why would you bring him?” He asks, glaring at Peter.

“Because there’s a chance you could be a modern day Buffalo Bill.” You shrug, leaning against the wall leaving a comfortable space between the two of you.

“Who?” His brow connects and confusion plays on his face. Your hope wasn’t even up and somehow you felt disappointed.

“Never mind.” You mumble. Steve always got your serial killer references.

“A fucking serial killer.” Peter grinds out, folding his arms over his chest. “You could be god knows what.” He huffs.

“I’m not a liar.” John smirks at Peter.

“Watch it.” Peter growls, stepping forward. You step between them. You level Peter with a look, he steps back. Turning you look at John.

“Bring him up and I’ll sucker punch you myself.” You warn him.

“Okay.” John nods slowly.

“What tattoo came first?” You fold your arms over your chest, standing in front of John, Peter stood a breathe behind you.

“Shoulder to elbow. Solar system and galaxies.” He nods.

“Why did I pick it?” You ask, wondering if you’d trip him up. He chuckles.

“You didn’t, I did.” He smiles. “Cause I’ve loved the sky, stars, and space since I was a kid.” He explains.

“Tell me, more.” You nod.

“Than came your pick. The moon, clouds and stars below your collar bone.” He speaks softly, eyeing the space covered by your shirt.

“I thought it was fitting.” You shrug.

“You’ve always found peace in the sky.” He smirks. Your head tips.

“How?” You shake your head, stunned he knew that.

“Just a guess. That’s why I picked the moon phases.” He smiles, it’s filled with hope and excitement. You’re barely even awake, let alone thrilled to hear anything he says.

“Oh.” You blink. That’s not what Steve told you, that’s not why he picked the moons.

“Than it was her.” John purrs, taking your wrist and exposing the woman tattooed on your forearm.

“Don’t touch.” Peter growls. John shoots him a dirty look but keeps talking.

“She’s you. My dream girl.” He runs his finger over the woman on your skin. You shiver, but not like with Steve, it’s cold and makes you yank your arm away from him.

“Oh brother.” Peter gags.

“Three’s a crowd baby. Lose the puppy.” John licks his lips, reaching up to touch you. You slap his hand away.

“I’m good, Ted Bundy.” You snort, shaking your head. You back up, Peter rolls his eyes turning to follow you.

“It’s John.” He calls after you. Peter throws his arm over your shoulder as he walks you back towards his car.

“Wow he’s fucking stupid.” Peter snorts.

“Steve always got my serial killer references.” You admit softly.

“I know. He has a book on them. The classics, the big ones. He used to say it was a guilty pleasure he never understood. Makes sense it was because of you.” Peter smirks at you, pulling open the door. He said it to comfort you, but all it did was tangle up your insides more.



————————



“I’m just not sure.” You sigh, running your hands through your hair. Peter was walking you to your car.

“Do me a favor.” Peter leans against your car. “Stay away from him, till I have him checked out.” He nods.

“Checked out?” You lift a brow.

“My God Father, Hap is a cop. I’ll have look into John.” Peter nods.

“Why do you care?” You snort.

“Look Y/N,” Peter sighs, scrapping his hand down his face “I know what Steve did was fucked up and wrong. I’m with you one hundred percent.” He nods, watching you. “But I trust Steve with my life at the end of the day. But that guy?” Peter scuffs. “I wouldn’t let him buy you an ice cream cone.” He snorts.

“I’m not really in the mood to see anyone anyways. I’m just going to go home.” You sigh, your shoulders sagging.

“I’ll look into this guy. Just something seems so familiar and off about things he said.” He shakes his head, his brow pulled down in concentration.

“Really?” You lift a brow, maybe you weren’t the only one.

“Like I’ve seen or heard it before.” He sighs. “I’ll figure it out.” He nods.

“Thanks Peter.” You give him a small smile, hugging him quickly. He opens your car door, waiting for you to get in. Peter closes it for you, waving as he backs up, heading for the shop.

by lesbianartemis

Hammer Time: I LOOK FORWARD TO MEETING THE ONE WHO STOLE THE CHILD OF SPIDER’S HEART.

Spider Son: what????????

Mini Me: excuse me

Or, in which Peter and Shuri Are Not Dating, the team definitely does not believe them, the Dora Milaje are terrifying, and Loki knows when you’re lying.

Words: 3157, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

Series: Part 2 of Avengers Text Verse, Part 7 of Iron Dad, Spider Son, and their Dysfunctional but Nonetheless Amusing Family

blog.name: scavengingforwords
blog.title:
Fandom!
(largely Marvel Fandom)
blog.description: I'm a nerd who gets sucked into tons of fandoms, here is where I will gather my fandom love. Let’s be honest though, at this point this is like 99.99% Marvel and of that percentage 99% of it is Avengers Academy related.
